intro: Diploptera stenocarpoides, commonly known as the narrow-fruited diploptera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature common in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
